newsitem.title: GERMANY: New Sanacorp shares priced at 35 marks.
newsitem.headline: New Sanacorp shares priced at 35 marks.

text.p: New shares in German pharmaceutical wholesaler group Sanacorp Pharmahandel AG will be issued at 35 marks each, the top of their bookbuilding range, lead manager DG Bank said on Monday.
Roughly two million Sanacorp shares, each with a par value of five marks, are due to be listed from October 25 on the Frankfurt and Munich stock exchanges.
DG Bank said the share offer was oversubscribed 37-fold during the bookbuilding phase.
Sanacorp, Germany's fourth largest drugs wholesaler, has said the offering will help it equip itself better against its competitors in Germany and Europe.
The company plans to invest part of the capital generated by the offering in its existing operations and set aside some to finance future acquisitions in Europe.
